paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql.functions import *

data = sqlContext.read.text("/user/cloudera/data/amazon_baby")
data = data.select(
        split('value',',')[0].alias('name'),
        split('value',',')[1].alias('review'),
        split('value',',')[2].alias('rating').cast('int')
).filter(col('rating').isNotNull()).cache()
print data.take(3)

result.msg: [Row(name=u'Planetwise Wipe Pouch', review=u'it came early and was not disappointed. i love planet wise bags and now my wipe holder. it keps my osocozy wipes moist and does not leak. highly recommend it.', rating=5), Row(name=u'Annas Dream Full Quilt with 2 Shams', review=u'Very soft and comfortable and warmer than it looks...fit the full size bed perfectly...would recommend to anyone looking for this type of quilt', rating=5), Row(name=u"Nature's Lullabies Second Year Sticker Calendar", review=u'This was the only calender I could find for the second year. I did one for the first and wanted to continue cause there are so many things to note still after they turn 1. This one was better than the first year one I got him.', rating=5)]

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
cleaner = TextCleanupTransformer(inputCol='review', outputCol='clean_review')
clean_data = cleaner.transform(data)

print_df(clean_data,4)

result.msg:
name	review	rating	clean_review
Planetwise Wipe Pouch	it came early and was not disappointed. i love planet wise bags and now my wipe holder. it keps my osocozy wipes moist and does not leak. highly recommend it.	5	it came early and was not disappointed  i love planet wise bags and now my wipe holder  it keps my osocozy wipes moist and does not leak  highly recommend it

This one was better than the first year one I got him.	5	This was the only calender I could find for the second year  I did one for the first and wanted to continue cause there are so many things to note still after they turn 1  This one was better than the first year one I got him 
Nature's Lullabies Second Year Sticker Calendar	I completed a calendar for my son's first year and really enjoyed tracking all of his milestones and special moments - so much so that I wanted to continue in the second year since he's still doing amazing and fun things every day.  I really like the simple layout of the calendar and while it might not have all the questions and milestone stickers you want - at least it's something to keep recording all those special moments!	4	I completed a calendar for my son s first year and really enjoyed tracking all of his milestones and special moments   so much so that I wanted to continue in the second year since he s still doing amazing and fun things every day   I really like the simple layout of the calendar and while it might not have all the questions and milestone stickers you want   at least it s something to keep recording all those special moments

I completed a calendar for my son's first year and really enjoyed tracking all of his milestones and special moments - so much so that I wanted to continue in the second year since he's still doing amazing and fun things every day.  I really like the simple layout of the calendar and while it might not have all the questions and milestone stickers you want - at least it's something to keep recording all those special moments!

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.ml.feature import *

stages = [
    TextCleanupTransformer(inputCol='review', outputCol='clean_review'),
    SQLTransformer(statement='SELECT *,CASE WHEN rating < 3 THEN 0.0 ELSE 1.0 END AS sentiment FROM __THIS__'),
    Tokenizer(inputCol='clean_review', outputCol='words'),
    StopWordsRemover(inputCol='words', outputCol='vwords', stopWords=['the','a','and','or', 'it', 'this', 'of', 'an', 'as', 'in', 'on', 'is', 'are', 'to']),
    CountVectorizer(inputCol='vwords', outputCol='features', minDF=2.0)
]
pipe = Pipeline(stages = stages)
pipe_model = pipe.fit(data)

clean_data = pipe_model.transform(data)
print_df(clean_data,4)
